pkgmetadata.longdescription: Model-Free Knockoff Filter for Controlled Variable Selection // Model-free knockoffs are a general procedure for controlling the false discovery rate (FDR) when performing variable selection. For more information, see the website below and the accompanying paper: Candes et al., "Panning for Gold: Model- free Knockoffs for High-dimensional Controlled Variable Selection", 2016, arXiv:1610.02351.
